body: Try to use `docker-compose -f docker-compose.prod.yml build` and then `docker-compose -f docker-compose.prod.yml up`
@VitaliyPetroff This builds only the backend and so does all the commands mentioned in the stack overflow answer tagged but the frontend still isn't getting upgraded.

I have the same problem. When I deployed the project using docker-compose by pulling the github project, the project looks older and not as in demo http://doccano.herokuapp.com/. Why is that? Am I missing something here?

After deleting `doccano_www` and `doccano_static_volume`, please try `docker-compose -f docker-compose.prod.yml build` and `up`:

```
❯ docker volume ls
DRIVER              VOLUME NAME
local               doccano_node_modules
local               doccano_postgres_data
local               doccano_static_volume
local               doccano_venv
local               doccano_www
❯ docker volume rm doccano_www
❯ docker volume rm doccano_static_volume
```

DON'T DELETE `doccano_postgres_data`.

@Hironsan , let's add this instruction to the Wiki/README?

Also mentioned in: #614, #656, #689.
Agree.. Will update it in the README

> 
> I have the same problem. When I deployed the project using docker-compose by pulling the github project, the project looks older and not as in demo http://doccano.herokuapp.com/. Why is that? Am I missing something here?

I am experiencing the same! I tried latest version Doccano and running in a local server. When I move to Heroku, it shows the previous version of user interface.

any help would be appreciated
